intro: Kuhnia glabrata, commonly known as the smooth kuhnia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cup. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique structure and habitat, it plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
